Our historical world had a great deal of difficulty in these times but the folks of that era survived without magic, without scads of adventurers to flood local coffers with cash. Shadowglade seeks to emulate that world more than one of traditional sword and sorcery; to help Game Masters exploring this realm we have composed Hearth & Home, a collection and expansion of OGL and original material to assist in world building. Culled from several sources, both gaming and historical, and tweaked for a Shadowglade flavor this guide includes a number of helpful charts, tables, and topics to build your own settlements for Shadowglade or any other fantasy realm!

Tables! Lots of tables, new and reproduced for easy access, to determine distances, populations, acreage, buildings, residences, and more!
Trust! An excellent subsystem to recreate the uneasy little town atmosphere, expanded to include specific forms of trust, variations how to set and manage trust in a community, and more!
Qualities & Traits! Additional settlement qualities and character traits to further tweak and hook your characters to the small town mentality.
Old Nobside settlement; stat block, history, and some roleplaying notes for a community constructed with these very rules!




This guide is intended for game masters only! Part of the suspense of Shadowglade lies in mystery, misdirection, and exploration; if you are almost exclusively a player or intended on playing in the campaign setting before running, its a good idea to leave this book be.

139460.name: Game Master's Guide to Shadowglade
139460.description:
From publisher blurb:

Supernatural suspense, horror, and action await the unwary in Shadowglade! 500 years ago, the world ended. More than that, it was forgotten, the minds of those alive scoured clean of knowledge, history, and identity. In the intervening years, society has rebuilt as best it could, new alliances have been forged and blood-sworn enemies made as the surviving nations have begun to rediscover their roots. Out in the wilds and darkness, however, not all that lurks is friendly...or human...or even alive.

The history of Shadowglade is one shrouded in mystery and uncertainty. The ruling nations and popular churches and inquisitive souls have documented what little history they could, however, in an attempt to ensure the ravages of time could not scour what little they knew ever again.

Welcome to the world of Shadowglade! Centuries ago, the world was shattered, devastated, and lost to all alive. No one knows what happened on that fateful day, nor much of anything about the world before...until now! This jam-packed Game Master's Guide contains everything you need to know about the modern world of Shadowglade and more!

Dozens of pages detailing not only the world of Shadowglade as it is today, but the world that it was before the cataclysmic Upheaval! Learn what forces conspired and led to the loss of entire civilizations and what forces arrayed, were overcome, and still lurk to this day!
Included and expanded OGL rule systems, including new materials on: Fear and Terror, Magic & Spells unique to Shadowglade, Sanity Points, Skills, Traits & Defects, and more!
Dozens of pages on starting and running Shadowglade campaigns, including advice on starting the campaign and several scenarios and hooks to get the team together, maintaining tense atmospheres and storytelling mood, and more!
BONUS! Included is a 31 page Basic Bestiary, containing approved and suggested creatures for the campaign; new, updated, and expanded looks at classic creatures suitable for the campaign setting; some basic templates to make crafting unusual creatures on the fly easier; and finally some basic encounter tables for common environs found in the realm!




This guide is intended for game masters only! Part of the suspense of Shadowglade lies in mystery, misdirection, and exploration; if you are almost exclusively a player or intended on playing in the campaign setting before running, its a good idea to leave this book be. For game masters, however, this guide contains everything you need!

139461.name: Priests of Shadowglade
139461.description:
From publisher blurb:

Supernatural suspense, horror, and action await the unwary in Shadowglade! 500 years ago, the world ended. More than that, it was forgotten, the minds of those alive scoured clean of knowledge, history, and identity. In the intervening years, society has rebuilt as best it could, new alliances have been forged and blood-sworn enemies made as the surviving nations have begun to rediscover their roots. Out in the wilds and darkness, however, not all that lurks is friendly...or human...or even alive.

Faith is paramount in a world lost in darkness, and no world is darker than that of Shadowglade. The priests of the realm represent a great many faiths, but all have a singular goal: to bring peace to their flock, wherever they may be and whatever trials they may face.
The Priest is a 20-level class written for use in the Shadowglade campaign setting but suitable for other settings as well. Essentially a divine bard, the priests of Shadowglade offer support to the downtrodden, words of encouragement and, with the righteous fire of their faith, condemnation of those who would harm their charges. Included in this booklet are:

Levels 1 - 20 for the Priest! While Shadowglade operates with a strong Epic 10 recommendation, all players interested in the class should be able to play it anywhere!
Favored Class Options, Traits, and Defects! Small hooks, but strong additions to the right back story, several hooks in the form of class options, traits, and defects are included!

139462.name: Shadowglade Knightguard
139462.description:
From publisher blurb:

Supernatural suspense, horror, and action await the unwary in Shadowglade! 500 years ago, the world ended. More than that, it was forgotten, the minds of those alive scoured clean of knowledge, history, and identity. In the intervening years, society has rebuilt as best it could, new alliances have been forged and blood-sworn enemies made as the surviving nations have begun to rediscover their roots. Out in the wilds and darkness, however, not all that lurks is friendly...or human...or even alive.

In the world of Shadowglade, shining knights of virtue are rare. A world of grey, where no one is truly good or truly evil, few paragons exist that exemplify the best the shattered race of man has to offer. While not perfect, the Knightguard of Shadowglade do their best to support their fellow residents and stand as a testament to the power of order and compassion.
The Shadowglade Knightguard is a 20-level class written for use in the Shadowglade campaign setting but suitable for other settings as well. Essentially a lawful neutral paladin, the knightguard exist to uphold the law and defend all protected under its watch. Police and protectors of Shadowglade's interests both at home and abroad, the knightguard offer security in a questionable world, a step up for the less fortunate with the skill and heart to become a knightguard, and a shining example of the best Shadowglade has to offer the world. Included in this booklet are:

Levels 1 - 20 for the Shadowglade Knightguard! While Shadowglade operates with a strong Epic 10 recommendation, all players interested in the class should be able to play it anywhere!
New Equipment! A handful of new pieces of equipment suitable for the knightguard and others in similar lines of work.
Favored Class Options, Traits, and Defects! Small hooks, but strong additions to the right back story, several hooks in the form of class options, traits, and defects are included!

139463.name: Striders of Shadowglade
139463.description:
From publisher blurb:

Supernatural suspense, horror, and action await the unwary in Shadowglade! 500 years ago, the world ended. More than that, it was forgotten, the minds of those alive scoured clean of knowledge, history, and identity. In the intervening years, society has rebuilt as best it could, new alliances have been forged and blood-sworn enemies made as the surviving nations have begun to rediscover their roots. Out in the wilds and darkness, however, not all that lurks is friendly...or human...or even alive.

The path of the open road is appealing to many, especially those wary of the political inclinations of the city-states and the undue influence exhibited by the churches of the realm. For some, the decision is a simple one: strike out on your own and make the best of world as you find it.
Striders of Shadowglade are just these sorts of folks. Disenchanted with the hierarchies and regimented life around them, they have chosen instead to walk their own road. Comfortable in the concrete streets of the big city or the quiet hamlets of the woodlands, they find home and shelter where they can and make a community of their own, beholden to no one but themselves and those they choose to trust. Included in this booklet are:

Levels 1 - 20 for the Strider, a spell-less ranger variant with some entertaining options! While Shadowglade operates with a strong Epic 10 recommendation, all players interested in the class should be able to play it anywhere!
Favored Class Options, Traits, and Defects! Small hooks, but strong additions to the right back story, several hooks in the form of class options, traits, and defects are included!

139464.name: The Toymaker of Avenguard
139464.description:
From publisher blurb:

Supernatural suspense, horror, and action await the unwary in Shadowglade! 500 years ago, the world ended. More than that, it was forgotten, the minds of those alive scoured clean of knowledge, history, and identity. In the intervening years, society has rebuilt as best it could, new alliances have been forged and blood-sworn enemies made as the surviving nations have begun to rediscover their roots. Out in the wilds and darkness, however, not all that lurks is friendly...or human...or even alive.

Something dark stirs in the sleepy crossroads town of Avenguard. A string of murders of the innocent seems to have followed a cursed toymaker to town. Word spreads quickly and the weary toymaker resigned to his fate...
But not all is as it seems. Rumors sift through the town, stories. Some are dark and terrible, which if true means the toymaker is a greater monster than even initially suspected. But others paint a different portrait and offer the slim chance that, just maybe, the toymaker is innocent himself...

The Toy Maker of Avenguard is a Pathfinder OGL 3.5 adventure designed for 2-6 player characters, levels 1-3. A rogue or bard will be a strong asset for any party but they are not required for the successful completion of this adventure. The Toy Maker of Avenguard is a loosely designed, open-ended adventure that will require a lot of investigation and a heavy amount of role-playing from the characters.

139465.name: Peacekeepers
139465.description:
From publisher blurb:

A horde of super-powered troopers attacked Earth, demolished the most important cities, killed the major superheroes... but a masked supervillainess somehow drove them back. We survived the invasion. Now, it’s YOUR turn to become the global superhero team, maintain the peace and delve into the origins of the invaders.
Hopefully, you’ll get to save the world!

Peacekeepers is a mini-setting for Savage Worlds (requiring Super Powers Companion Explorer's Edition) or ICONS describing the world after an invasion of Ultimians.

You could use it on your own or incorporate it in an existing campaign. In this book you’ll find new threats and opportunities, some optional rules (like a Wealth system for Savage Worlds and Icons), some new Edges and Hindrances, a superheroic adventure generator and a random civilian events generator (to roll up what happens when you’re out of costume). It contains an outline of the Plot Point campaign, and two semi-related Savage Tales, complete with a collection of unusual suspects...

139466.name: Magicians: Language Learning RPG
139466.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fresh off a successful Kickstarter campaign, Magicians is a tabletop role-playing game designed to do two things very well:

tell awesome stories like you've read about in books such as the Harry Potter series, Le Guin's A Wizard of Earthsea, or Lev Grossman’s The Magicians; and
teach you a language - Korean.




How would you solve your problems if you were a teenager capable of magic? Can someone with the power to remake the world ever truly grow up? Magicians is about teenage drama, emotions, hormones and magic. It’s about students at Hwang-Gung College of Magical Pedagogy in Seoul, Korea, where students learn that there is a reason for Korean superstitions, and that there is a long history behind Korea’s folklore and mythology.

Nine-tailed foxes seduce the willing and prowl Seoul at night; dokkaebi roam the mountainside; and dragons live throughout the many rivers and lakes of Korea, while other strange and foreign creatures hide in plain sight. Students learn magic, deal with life as teenagers, and relearn everything they know about the world – secret underground magical orders sew sesame seeds into their skin and tattoo themselves with blood. Dogs with human faces barter souls.

And with the knowledge of these terrible things comes terrible danger.

Magicians is all about magic. It’s about removing all constraints so that the only thing holding you back is what you know. There is no need for a teacher – all you need is your phone, your friends, and a few hours every week. If you've ever wondered what casting magic would sound like or feel like, or if you've ever wanted a tangible system you can grab hold of and be creative with, then you’ll be learning Korean and casting spells in no time.

Knowledge is the only thing that can set power free – so start learning.

139467.name: Contenders (Ronnies 2 submission)
139467.description:
Designer's description:
A role-playing game of blood and sweat pain and hope. Contenders is a rpg dealing with the shady and painful world of boxing. Each player takes on the role of a contender, a pugilist trying to overcome his pain and fight his way out of the gutter. This is a submission for the ronnies 2, taking inspiration from Pain and Fight.
(from post on 1km1kt)

User comment:
This is the original version of the game as published on the 1km1kt website as an entry for the Ronnies 2 contest. It is available from both 1km1kt and as a demo from the publisher of the, more developed, commercially published version of the game. The content of the demo download and the 1km1kt files are the same.

139468.name: Red Rain
139468.description:
from the Introduction:
Red Rain is a role-playing game about boxers dealing with serious issues inside and outside of the boxing ring.

The game requires three players. Two players take on the role of opposing boxers getting ready for their fight against one another. And, one player takes on the role of the “referee,” overseeing the drama that builds around these two fighters, their relationships, and their ultimate confrontation in the ring.

The game has two distinct phases. First, players explore the tough lives of the two boxers, resolving the fighters’ personal issues and working through their difficult choices as they prepare for the big fight. Then, players actually play through the boxing match, round by round and blow by blow, to decide which of the two fighters emerges the victor.

Players will need a deck of poker-style playing cards (remove the jokers), and a couple pieces of paper to keep track of the fighters and their relationships.

139469.name: Open Gaming Monthly (Issue 1- Mar 2013)
rpgissuearticle: The Good, The Bad, The Henchmen
139469.description:
Open Gaming Monthly
Issue #1
March 2013
Cover by McLean Kendree

139470.name: Keep It Sunny
139470.description:
From the Introduction:

You've seen It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, right? This is a game where you pretend to be those characters, and create an episode of the show that never was.

139471.description:
Rise in status and lead your city to greatness in a unique game that combines wizards with wooly mammoths, thieves with tanks, and the absolute with the archaic. Use your city's exclusive abilities to wage war, make allies, and achieve objectives while gaining power. Fantasy, Early Men, Thief, Modern, Utopian, and Medieval cities are all brought together in a race to victory while vying for the honor to lead this new extraordinary world.

Will you choose hostility, or be the model of civility?

Civility is a board game for 2 to 4 players where players get to choose a city to control. There are 6 cities to choose from - Early Men, Fantasy, Modern, Utopian, Thief, and Medieval. Each city has 4 unique abilities and different starting strengths. Different cities will require completely different strategies and planning. The goal of the game is to reach status 5. This is done by claiming status cards that have specific goals associated with them. Each status card is unique so the victory conditions will vary with each play creating a vastly different experience every time.
139471.name: Civility

139472.name: Beyond the Walls and Other Adventures Playtest package
rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures
139472.description:
From the PDF:

Welcome to Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures. This is a simple set of rules similar to older versions of the world’s most popular fantasy roleplaying game. The game is designed to be easy to learn and fast to use during play. There are many such games available. Beyond the Wall is different for two reasons:

1) Flavor - Beyond the Wall can model most kinds of fantasy stories, but is particularly well-suited for a certain kind of fantasy literature best exemplified by Ursula K. LeGuin’s first three Earthsea novels and Lloyd Alexander’s Chronicles of Prydain. These are mostly stories of low fantasy about young heroes finding their way in dangerous situations.

2) Out-of-the Box Play - While the core rules of Beyond the Wall are similar to those of the numerous other games based on the world’s most popular fantasy roleplaying game, it does
offer something that the others do not: tools to play the game almost immediately and with little prep. Using special Character Playbooks and Scenario Packs, a group of players with a single gamemaster should be able to play the game with absolutely zero prep in about three to five hours, from making characters to tasting a glorious success or a bitter defeat.

The game still works perfectly well for traditional playstyles, but we made it as a vehicle for quick, on-the-fly play, as we often found ourselves wanting to be able to sit down and play a roleplaying game without all the fuss that is normally involved.

rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures
139473.name: Beyond the Walls and Other Adventures Nobility Playtest package
139473.description:
From the PDF:

Check out our Nobility Character Playbooks, including the Nobleman's Wild Daughter, the Gifted Dilettante, and the Forgotten Child. These playbooks introduce multi-class characters and a new setting for your adventures Beyond the Wall.

rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures
139474.name: Beyond the Walls and Other Adventures Elf, Dwarf, and Halfling Playtest package
139474.description:
From the PDF:

Check out our Elf, Dwarf, and Halfling Playbooks. These playbooks introduce new fantasy races as player character options for your adventures Beyond the Wall.

139475.name: LIFER
139475.description:
Players of LIFER asume the role of prisoners in Rawdeal Prison, equipped only with a handful of cigarettes they use as currency to acquire their stash of inventory.

To begin, up to four players are dealt 6 cigarette cards of various values. These are then traded in turn for cards with the corresponding values in the Inventory deck. Players begin to amass equipment such as, Bolt Cutters, Files, Picks and Blueprints to set them en route to escape.

There are 3 separate routes out of jail, and prisoners must collect the correct combination of inventory cards to complete their escape. The first to collect the correct combination is the winner.

But all is not simple, the Inventory deck is peppered with Trick Cards, such as the Warden and the Thug, which allow players to poach cards from their opponents. There are also detention cards such as Solitary and Infirmary which alters players progress through the game.

139476.description:
This Flagship plastic miniature is an upgrade to the cardboard token that represents the players' ship in Space Cadets. It fits within a one inch square, and stands on its built-in pedestal to a total height of about half an inch. This was produced as a preorder incentive. Stronghold Games has indicated that this was never to be sold after the initial release of the game, and would only be available via special giveaways thereafter.

This is a blue plastic ship, and Space Cadets: Ship of The Line is gray.
139476.name: Space Cadets: Flagship

139477.name: Dice
139477.description:
A fast strategy and tactics dice game for 2–4 players. The game comprises 36 dice than can be placed in a 6×6 grid on a playing board. Each player considers the outer row of six dice which he is facing (his 'home row') and will try that either a) all six dice show the same number, or b) the dice be placed in ascending (1-2-…-6) or descending (6-5-…-1) order. For this, 35 dice are placed in the playing area leaving an empty space, and the 36th die is used as action die: the active player rolls it, and the rolled value can be split into several sub-values (for example: 6 = 3+1+1+1) to perform one or more of several possible actions, such as turning a die, swap files, etc.
DICE provides several options to build the starting dice grid, as well as advanced rules for a longer and more challenging game experience (additional dice moves and a more challenging winning condition).
DICE is available in several colored sets: Natur (36 white dice); Regenbogen (6× 6 dice in each of the colors red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and violet); Devil Dice (black dice with red pips, and the pips are randomly placed on the die faces, making it impossible to predict which value will show after turning a die); and also two- or three-color dice sets.
More colors means a more complicated game and more possible tactical variations, as additional winning conditions can be established (for example, a home row with alternating black and white dice, if a two color DICE set is used).
According to the rules leaflet included with the game, there also exists a set of 121 dice called MARATHON DICE.

139479.name: The Addams Family (NES)
139479.description:
The Addams Family's lawyer, Tully Alford, has taken control of their Gothic mansion and imprisoned Morticia Addams, Pugsley Addams, Wednesday Addams, Granny and Uncle Fester. The player controls Gomez Addams as he explores the various rooms in the mansion, locating items and battling monsters, until he has located all of the lost family members.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Addams Family (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

139480.name: Little Red Hood
139480.description:
Little Red Hood is loosely based on the Little Red Riding Hood story. The player takes on the role of the main protagonist "Little Red Hood" whose objective is to reach her grandmother's house.
The majority of the levels feature Little Red Hood in a forest filled with goblin-like enemies. Little Red Hood must avoid these enemies while attempting to reach the next stage.
Little Red Hood can jump over obstacles and perform a kick during the game, however the latter is ineffective at dealing any damage to any enemies.

Source: Wikipedia, "Little Red Hood", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

139482.name: Iron Soldier 2
139482.description:
Back of the Box

Pilot your 42 foot mech robot through 20 new missions against the evil Penta Forces.

139483.name: BattleSphere
139483.description:
800 years in the future, the seven dominant races of the galaxy are at war. Stealing a plot idea from an ancient Star Trek episode, they have agreed to confine their hostilities to Sector 51, a spherical sector of space formerly used by the Earth government to secretly test new weapons and starships. Each race has sent its best soldiers and military hardware to participate in a tournament of space battles in this Battle Sphere. The race that wins the tournament will be given control of the galaxy.

Source: Wikipedia, "BattleSphere", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

139484.name: Pirate101
139484.description:
A swashbuckling free Pirate game with fun adventure for kids and adults alike!
Pirate101 is a free online game set in a mythical world of flying Pirate ships, strange beasts and amazing Pirate treasure! Both casual game and MMO players of all ages will enjoy creating their custom Pirate character to explore magical game worlds and sail off for hidden treasure.
Pirate101 is a free family game that parents and kids can enjoy together!
With many online safety steps in place, Pirate101 creates an environment of fun gameplay and adventure that the whole family can enjoy. Win items for your custom Pirate ship in the fun free mini games, and fight tough boss battles to collect rare gear like Pirate swords and epic outfits.

In the Pirate101 free online game, fend off enemies with your Pirate ships' cannons or jump on board enemy ships and defeat bad guys with innovative board game style combat.

From the Game Website

139485.description:
The game recreates the atmosphere of a Motogp Race based on real statistical data.

It's possible to make a single race or the whole MOTOGP championship of 2011,2102,2013 and 2015 season.

The game it's specially designed for solitaire play.

Pilot cards, circuit cards, race sheet, miniatures and a generic circuit board need to develop every race.

The game needs also the use of serveral dice (1d10 and more d6 dice).

Game lenght 45 minutes - 1 hour per race.

THE GAME IS FREE TO PRINT AND PLAY
IN ITALIAN / ENGLISH
139485.name: SP MOTOGP WORLD

139486.name: Requiem
139486.description:
from the back of the book

A new Hungarian roleplaying core book published by Beneficium. In the pages of this book you find a detailed world and an easy to use game system,

139487.name: Almanaque
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (2nd Edition)
139487.description:
user summary

This book is the Spanish 2nd Edition Core Rules. It includes some background information and a rules changes summary to adapt 1st edition to 2nd edition (meaning you need the 1st edition Core Book to play), and has content from both the Player's Guide and the Game Master's Guide.


in English

The Almanac is a conversion guide for the 2nd Edition of Legend of the 5 Rings, including in one book of the Player's Guide and part of the Game Master's Guide.

Contents:

Chapter 1: Historical information on how to start the Clan Wars and the status of each of these at the beginning of it.
Chapter 2: NPC relevant to each clan, nagas and ronin also important during this arc.
Chapter 3 summarizes the changes from the first version, new skills, and advanced schools.
Chapter 4: Magic, new mechanics and spells
Chapter 5: Resume secrets of every clan, its aims and ambitions, and introduces us to the Darkness.

'Publisher Blurb:

So you say the honor is stronger than steel, right?

Prove it.

In a land consumed by dark magic, sorcerers honorable samurai and shugenja must forge a new path into the future to try to save the Emerald Empire from destruction.

It has been two years since the failed coup Scorpion Clan, and an unsuspecting Rokugan is on the precipice. The Crab abandons Kaiu Wall accompanied by new and sinister allies. The Lion and the Crane forget all prudence and thrown against each other to settle old debts. The Dragon, always hiding in his mountain, stretches before an impending catastrophe only he perceives. The Phoenix tries to discover the sinister truth behind the smoke of battle, but could lose his soul in the process. The Unicorn awaits his time, watching their new home in flames. The Naga finally awaken from sleep millennium. The Scorpion has fallen from grace and is in disarray. The ronin are organized under the banner of the greatest general of Rokugan. A sick emperor sits on the throne Esmeralda.

It's the moment of truth.

Almanac collects all the material necessary to bring your games of Legend of the Five Rings to the second edition of the game.

in Spanish

El Almanaque es una guía de conversión para la 2ª Edición de Leyenda de los 5 Anillos, incluyendo en un sólo libro parte del Player's Guide y parte del Game Master's Guide.

Contenidos:

Capítulo 1: Informacion historica sobre como empieza la Guerra de Clanes y el estado de cada uno de estos al inicio de la misma.
Capítulo 2: PNJ relevantes de cada clan, asi como nagas y ronin importantes durante este arco.
Capítulo 3: Resume los cambios con respecto a la primera version, las nuevas habilidades, y escuelas avanzadas.
Capítulo 4: Magia, nuevas mecanicas y hechizos
Capítulo 5: Resume secretos de cada clan, sus propositos y ambiciones, y nos presenta a la Oscuridad viviente.

Publisher Blurb:

Así que dices que el honor es más poderoso que el acero, ¿no?

Demuéstralo.

En una tierra consumida por la magia oscura, honorables samurai y hechiceros shugenja deben forjar una nueva senda hacia el futuro para intentar salvar al Imperio Esmeralda de la destrucción.

Han pasado dos años desde el fallido golpe del clan Escorpión, y un desprevenido Rokugan se halla al borde del precipicio. El Cangrejo abandona la Muralla Kaiu acompañado por nuevos y siniestros aliados. El León y la Grulla olvidan toda prudencia y se lanzan el uno contra el otro para saldar viejas deudas. El Dragón, siempre oculto en su montaña, se despereza ante la inminencia de una hecatombe que solo él percibe. El Fénix intenta descubrir la siniestra verdad oculta tras el humo de la batalla, pero podría perder su alma en el proceso. El Unicornio aguarda su momento, viendo cómo su nuevo hogar arde en llamas. Las Naga despiertan por fin de su sueño milenario. El Escorpión ha caído en desgracia y se encuentra en desbandada. Los ronin se organizan bajo el estandarte del más grande general de Rokugan. Un emperador enfermo se sienta en el trono Esmeralda.

Es la hora de la verdad.

Almanaque recopila todo el material necesario para llevar tus partidas de La Leyenda de los Cinco Anillos a la segunda edición del juego.

rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)
139490.name: Otosan Uchi (Book 1)
139490.description:
user summary

This is the first book of Spanish edition of the Otosan Uchi suplement for the 1st Edition of Legend of the Five Rings.
The original boxed set is split in two soft cover books. The fist one covers everything up to the Scorpion's Sting, and the second one covers the Scorpion's Sting itself.

rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)
139491.name: Otosan Uchi 2
rpgitemversion: Otosan Uchi: La Picadura del Escorpión - Spanish Edition Book 2
139491.description:
user comment

This is the second book of Spanish edition of the Otosan Uchi supplement for the 1st Edition of Legend of the Five Rings.
The original boxed set is split in two soft cover books. The fist one covers everything up to the Scorpion's Sting, and the second one covers the Scorpion's Sting itself.

Publisher Blurb: in English

The sting of the Scorpion

In Otosan Uchi discover the inhabitants of the most powerful city in all of Rokugan and jealously hide the secrets to others.

In this second volume, The Sting of the Scorpion, all these interlocking plots converge to present what is undoubtedly the most important event in the recent history of the Emerald Empire: the Scorpion Clan Coup, an exciting adventure of honor, duty, sacrifice and betrayal that will give your character the ability to decide, over a five-day war, the fate of Rokugan.

Who will sit on the throne when the dust Esmeralda aposente?

Put on your armor, prays to the Fortunes and jump into battle. But remember: when the Scorpion is involved, things are never what they seem ...

Publisher Blurb: in Spanish

La picadura del Escorpión

En Otosan Uchi descubriste a los moradores de la más poderosa ciudad de todo Rokugan, así como los secretos que celosamente ocultan a los demás.

En este segundo volumen, La picadura del Escorpión, todas estas tramas entrelazadas confluyen para presentar el que sin duda es el acontecimiento más importante en la historia reciente del Imperio Esmeralda: el golpe del Clan Escorpión, una trepidante aventura de honor, deber, sacrificio y traición que dará a tus personajes la posibilidad de decidir, a lo largo de cinco días de guerra, el destino de todo Rokugan.

¿Quién se sentará en el Trono Esmeralda cuando el polvo se aposente?

Ponte la armadura, reza a las Fortunas y salta a la batalla. Pero recuerda: cuando el Escorpión está involucrado, las cosas nunca son lo que parecen...

139492.description: This expansion set includes 2 sets of three different dogs. Their accompanying cards are placed in the equipment deck, and when found, the holder of the card becomes that dog's handler. Actions can be spent to command the dog to move, search, and attack. Dogs give their handler extra melee dice when in the same zone.
139492.name: Zombicide Box of Dogs Set #6: Dog Companions

139493.name: Sugar Cube: Bittersweet Factory
139493.description:
From Publisher's Website

A cube of sugar escapes from factories to avoid the fate of becoming a cookie!

Sugar Cube: Bittersweet Factory is a 2D platformer game that presents the story of a sugar cube. The background tiles of the game have two sides, namely, the front and the back. These tiles can be flipped for access to critical hints to solve different levels. They may or may not help you, so pay attention!

The game is the full version of IGF China 2010's winner, Sugar Cube. It includes 5 factory themes containing 90 levels and 2 endings. Also included is the full soundtrack of the game. Also included is the full Sugar Cube: Bittersweet Factory Soundtrack.

139494.name: Words of Art
139494.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the party game Words of Art, players use the letter cards in their hand to build words – the catch is, the words have to relate to the text on the Description Card, or with the picture on the Art Card.

Luckily each of your cards shows two letters on it, and you choose which letter to use on each card. Each letter has a point value, plus you'll get bonus points for every card used, so creativity is rewarded!

139495.name: Stop It!
139495.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the fast-playing, five-suited card game Stop It! players battle to lay down all of their cards. There are no set turns. Whoever has the next card in numerical and color sequence is the one who plays. With careful planning, you can run the table – but don't get cocky. Opponents can stop gameplay by claiming a "Stop It!" card and start a new run of their own.

139496.name: SimCity (2013)
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Gamescom Best PC Game of the Year Winner
2013 D.I.C.E. Social Networking Game/Web Based Game of the Year Winner
2013 Global Game Awards Best Management Game of the Year Nominee
139496.description:
This is a new SimCity that delivers unprecedented depth of simulation. The model-like world and detail of the simulation make this the most responsive and personal SimCity ever. This is also the most expansive city management game yet where you can control a region that delivers true multi-city scale and play a single city or up to 16 cities at once each with different specializations. Multiplayer is also a first for the series, which adds a new dimension to your game as your decisions impact both your city and your region and creates new ways to play by collaborating or competing to earn achievements. Finally, SimCity is a live service that simulates real time updates from new challenges to new features and content.

Source: The Game Website.

139497.name: Fighter Pilot
139497.description:
Back of Box

Get in the air and in the enemy's face in seconds with Fighter Pilot. Fly fast and furious single missions, blast your way through an evolving campaign, or go head-to-head against your friends to see who's the ultimate Fighter Pilot.

[Picture captions]

Fast action jet combat: lock, load, and liquidate

Straight-forward interface gets you in the air and fighting fast

Intense, in-your-face dog fights keep the action up-close and personal

Multiplayer ready for head-to-head clashes and mile-high deathmatches

Four state-of-the-art jet fighters, armed-to-the-teeth

In-game assistance keeps you on target with battle-tested advice

Dazzling smoke trails and screen-melting explosions let you savor your kills

Complete a mission on your break or conquer the skies all night long

139498.name: Flight Commander With Mission Builder
139498.description:
User Summary

A Japanese adaptation of Flight Commander 2 and the Mission Builder which were only released separately in their English incarnations. Additional content for the Japanese conversion included mercenary scenarios based on the popular Japanese manga Area 88.

139499.name: The Emperor's Chosen
139499.description:
From the back of the hardcover US edition:

Tempered by battle, bound by brotherhood.

Only the most exceptional Battle-Brothers are seconded to the Deathwatch. Of those, only a rare few earn the right to be called Deathwatch veterans. Take your place among them.

Delve into the history of the Jericho Deathwatch and honour the heroic veteran Battle-Brothers that have come before you.

Assume a Heroic Legacy and combat your foes with tactical precision and martial excellence as a veteran Kill-team of the Deathwatch.

Follow in the footsteps of your predecessors and complete the mission that laid them low.

Join your brethren and pen your name in the history of the Jericho Reach!

A copy of Deathwatch Core Rulebook is needed to use this supplement.

From the publisher's website:

“Remain ever stalwart and let none escape judgment. A single man’s failings may wreak havoc on the galaxy.”
–Inquisitor Ghent

The Emperor’s Chosen is a supplement for Deathwatch dedicated to those rare Deathwatch Space Marines who ascend to the status of veteran.

This detailed tome lets players delve into the history of the Jericho Deathwatch and honor the heroic veteran Battle Brothers that have come before them. As part of a veteran Kill-team, Player Characters can assume a Heroic Legacy and combat their foes with tactical precision and martial excellence. Then, the included adventure invites Kill-teams to follow in the footsteps of their predecessors and complete the mission that laid them low!

139500.name: Formation Aerobatic
139500.description:
Have you ever dreamt to be a Aerobatic Airplane Pilot? It's here! Be a member of Aerobatic Team "Blue Impulse". Fly your airplane in perfect formation and maneuver!

Source: The Publisher Website.

User Summary

An aerobatics flight simulator based on the Japanese military flight demonstration team, Blue Impulse. Flight modes include free flight, training and aerobatic "missions." Flights may be recorded for later playback. Missions are scored and the game maintains a high score list.

139001.name: Quizkönig
139001.description:
Objective: gain as many quiz-cards as possible giving correct answers; become 'Quizkönig' and gets the crown.
- acting by turns -
Active player draws a card asking clockwise - correct answer? hand card over.. - if not, try yourself finding correct answer; if unsuccessful - ask next player; round ends after each player had an active task. Open questions are collected by the quizmaster.
Next round: contraclockwise
Next round: random
new session

Remarks:
content ~ 500 different questions;
product code on box differs from game code printed lid inside: 611 5 001 3;
some questions are niddles; if the quizmaster collects more cards than anyone else he may name the team 'dullards'

139002.name: Pesah Matza U'Maror
139002.description:
Triplets Passover game
It's a card game for the entire family. Players gain knowledge of various concepts related to the Passover story in a fun, dynamic setting

A set of three cards constitutes a triplet
The three concepts represented in the three cards may be connected to a proverbial saying from Jewish sources (the Torah or the Passover Haggadah). Alternately, three figures can make up a triplet if they share a familial connection.

139003.description:
Objective: gain most victory points giving correct answer as fast as possible
- acting simultaneously -
active player turns the spinner; spinner (mounted on a disc) ends up pointing at a letter & a theme (similar to http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/12043/stadt-land-fluss); get the name first collecting a victory point;
remarks:
several discs available
139003.name: Wer wird Quizsieger?

139004.name: X-Plane 5
139004.description:
X-Plane is the world's most comprehensive, powerful flight simulator, and has the most realistic flight model available for personal computers.

Welcome to the world of props, jets, single- and multi-engine airplanes, as well as gliders, helicopters and VTOLs such as the V-22 Osprey and AV8-B Harrier.

X-Plane comes with subsonic and supersonic flight dynamics, sporting aircraft from the Bell 206 Jet-Ranger helicopter and Cessna 172 light plane to the supersonic Concorde and Mach-3 XB-70 Valkyrie. X-Plane comes with about 40 aircraft spanning the aviation industry (and history), and several hundred more are freely downloadable from the internet.

X-Plane scenery is world-wide, with scenery for the entire planet Earth AND MARS! (thanks to the Mars Orbiting Laser Altimeter, which mapped that planet's elevation) You can land at any of over 18,000 airports, as well as test your mettle on aircraft carriers, helipads on building tops, frigates that pitch and roll in the waves, and oil rigs.

Weather is variable from clear skies and high visibility to thunderstorms with controllable wind, wind shear, turbulence, and microbursts! Rain, snow and clouds are available for an instrument flying challenge, and thermals are available for the gliders! Real weather conditions can be downloaded from the internet, allowing you to fly in the actual weather that currently exists!

X-Plane also has detailed failure-modeling, with 35 systems that can be failed manually or randomly, when you least expect it! You can fail instruments, engines, flight controls, and landing gear at any moment.

While X-Plane is the world's most COMPREHENSIVE flight sim, your purchase also comes with Plane-Maker (to create your own airplanes) World-Maker (to create your own scenery), and Weather Briefer (to get a weather briefing before the flight if you use real weather conditions downloaded from the net).

X-Plane is also extremely customizable, allowing you to easily create textures, sounds, and instrument panels for your own airplanes that you design or the planes that come with the sim.

X-Plane's accuracy (in flight model), scope (in aircraft and terrain coverage), versatility (in aircraft type and weather conditions), add-on programs (in aircraft and scenery editors), user-customizability, downloadable aircraft, and downloadable scenery makes it the ULTIMATE flight simulation experience for Macintosh AND Windows platforms.

Source: Archived Publisher Website.
