139095.name: Disney Gummi Bears: The Secret of Gummi Glen Game
139095.description: The Pantry shelf is empty and it's your task to fill it with some freshly brewed gummiberry juice. As you travel through Gummi Glen collecting needed ingredients, you'll visit scenic "Old Rumbler" Falls and the most delicious gummiberry patch in all the kingdom. You choose the route, but you must make all the stops, turning on the water in the pump room, racing through the quicktunnel and, of course, having the brew stirred in Grammi Gummi's kitchen. Be the first to reach the pantry after completing your journey and you will win the game.

139096.name: The Ranch Raid (Savage Worlds Edition)
139096.description:
From publisher blurb:

Things have gotten hot in Wellstone, maybe a little too hot. The best thing you can do is lay low, especially after that whole hotel fiasco. Then this job just lands in your lap. It's perfect: it's in Mexico, it's dealing with Wellstone City scumbags, and it's working with a high-level security company with few real ties to the City. As a matter of fact, it's almost too perfect...

This adventure is the sixth adventure of the Wellstone City Chronicles for the Wellstone City setting. This Savage adventure is 15 pages that takes the PCs out of their normal playground and sets them loose on some biker scumbags that the world would be better off without. They will be working with a highly trained organization on a direct hit on a fortified ranch 50 miles of the border. Oh. And they have an Apache.

The adventure is geared for 3 to 4 PCs and suggestions are given in the book to help ramp up the difficulty for either advanced characters or more players. It can be used in conjuction with the other Wellstone City Chronicles, and it can be used in any order with them. Grab this sixth installment of the Wellstone City modern urban adventure arc today!

Inside you’ll find:

A new security company that can be used in the future by GMs and Players alike
Maps detailing the locations, with expanded maps provided by Fabled Environments!
More connections in Wellstone
More fame and reputation to be gained as Freelancers instead of tying the PCs down to one of the crime syndicates

139097.name: The Ranch Raid (Aether Edition)
139097.description:
From publisher blurb:

139098.name: Red Blizzard (Ingenium Edition)
139098.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s a dark and snowy night. The snow is falling like heavy ash from a well-stoked fire, and there’s no sign it’s letting up any time soon. If anything, it’s coming down harder as the day turns to night; the snow so thick it’s almost blinding in the headlights.

Your eyes burn with the intensity of your gaze as it tries to pierce the veil of falling snow. Ahead you catch the glimpse of an animal in your headlights a second before you strike it; its eyes wide with fear as you register that you just hit a deer, and now the vehicle is skidding out of control.

It’s been a hard haul, and you are tired, and you’re caught in this blizzard. A sudden accident leaves you stranded in the middle of nowhere on a less-than-well-travelled road. The temperature is dropping down dangerously low, the storm is kicking up, and the thought of trying to weather through this storm is nerve-wracking.

Lights on the road ahead give a moment of hope and when the SUV pulls up, it’s a kindly looking older gentleman that introduces himself as Dr. Ramsey, but you can call him Doc, and he’s inviting you to his place for the night. His whole family is there, and they’re about to have a late dinner as soon as Doc returns, and there will be plenty, even with the PCs as guests.

This adventure takes place at Doc’s house, and the PCs learn very quickly that not is all as it appears at the Ramsey household. The PCs will have to fight for their freedom as they watch the entire family transform into werewolves and begin to hunt the party down slowly and methodically through the night…

Featuring the art of Storn Cook and the colors of Ben Overmyer, this 29 page adventure was co-written by Shannon Patrick and Kevin Rohan.

Inside this 29-page adventure, you’ll find:

A Fully Detailed victorian mansion
Rules for Silver Acclimated Werewolves
Brand New Illustrations done by Storn Cook
A one-shot adventure, a bridging adventure to be inserted into a campaign, or the kick-start to a supernatural game
Variation based on the number and power of your characters

139099.name: Midgard Legends
139099.description:
From the publisher's website:

Midgard's Most Renowned Legends Come to Life!

Bring dramatic history and wondrous myths to your game table: the legends of heroes, villains, monsters, and magic that define Midgard's most prominent regions. From the cold foothills of the Riphean Mountains to the burning lands of the Mharoti Empire to the brutal, wind-swept terrain of the Rothenian Steppes, these are the tales that have molded this world into a place of unrivaled wonder and mystery.

Included are a host of legendary monsters, class archetypes, magic items, and artifacts, as well as:

-23 Legendary Heroes, Villains, and Monsters suitable for any campaign.
-Five new spells straight from the spellbooks of the Black Sorceress of Crossroads and Aberus, first mage-lord of House Stross.
-Items of unbelievable power, including an intelligent crown that can impose its wicked will onto wearers.
-A new haunt that gives those living nearby impossible strength—and instills in them an unrivaled bloodlust.
-Complete stats for six incredible monsters and mythical figures, including Mharot, the hot-blooded dragon that forged an empire; Glatisant, the Questing Beast; and Jolinar, the unluckiest lucky man in Midgard.
-The heinous details of Blood Mother Margase, the mighty blood druid whose plans include godhood—and domination over all of Midgard!

These are the Midgardians' most beloved tales, and they are a rich source for adventure hooks, character backgrounds, allies and foes. Use them with the Midgard Campaign Setting, or bring any of these legendary figures and magic items to your own world!

139101.name: Interstellar Expeditions: Interstellar Players 3
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
139101.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Nearly fifteen years have passed since the end of the Word of Blake Jihad and the rise of the Republic of the Sphere. Yet even as the Inner Sphere adjusts to a new sense of normalcy, questions remain about whether the Blakist threat is gone for good or merely hibernating. Once a disorganized collective of hobbyists and academics backed by the idle wealthy, Interstellar Expeditions has emerged from the fires of war to take up the mission once claimed by ComStar's Explorer Corps: to search for the elusive hiding places where humanity's enemies might have gone. From the dead worlds within the borders of the Inner Sphere itself, to the distant, uncharted reaches of the Deep Periphery, IE relentlessly searches for the answers to mysteries dating back to mankind's first ventures into deep space, while simultaneously watching for any sign of the zealots who so recently waged the most horrendous interstellar war in modern history. Interstellar Expeditions: Interstellar Players 3 describes the organization and efforts of Interstellar Expeditions as it continues to search within (and beyond) human-occupied space in the BattleTech universe. First introduced in Interstellar Players, IE's operations have now gone truly universal, seeking answers and treasures not only from the lost and forgotten worlds of humanity's distant past, but also the distant colonies and civilizations that have risen-and even fallen-beyond the boundaries of the Inner Sphere. Gamemasters and players can decide which of these groups and discoveries may actually bear fruit, and which are the misdirections left behind by the surviving leaders of the Blakist war machine. Whether from this sourcebook or the gamemaster's own imagination, these discoveries can become the ultimate villain, ally, or unique new setting for any type of BattleTech campaign!

139102.name: Camp Wicakini 3: Wanagi Mato Lives! (Aether Edition)
139102.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five years after the horrible disaster that resulted in a total loss of Camp Wicakini, it's been rebuilt. New counselors, new buildings, new everything...except for one man.

The new caretaker, Max Mason, was one of the last campers to stay at Wicakini. He survived the initial zombie onslaught, and then the government came and rescued him. He has sworn that what happened on that fateful day almost exactly 5 years ago would never happen again, and this time, he's prepared.

Unfortunately, the blight of Camp Wicakini, Wanagi Mato, is also prepared, and has been plotting revenge for 5 years...

This sandbox style adventure follows the first Camp Wicakini adventures. The camp has been completely rebuilt, but in true slasher-film style, it's been rebuilt exactly the way it was. There's a few twists on this one, and unlike the first two which were campy (pardon the pun) this one is straight up horror survival.

There is a new addition to the grounds, a Ranger Station, put up by the government to help monitor any suspicious activity.

Maps have graciously been included by Fabled Environments once again, and this adventure is completely compatible with the map pack from Camp Wicakini: Part II (Aether Edition)!

Get in there and survive! This adventure is the perfect follow up for the first two adventures, and it's ideal for conventions or a quick pick-up game, with pre-generated characters, equipment lists, and everything you need to run it the second you pick it up!

139103.name: Camp Wicakini 3: Wanagi Mato Lives! (Savage Worlds Edition)
139103.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five years after the horrible disaster that resulted in a total loss of Camp Wicakini, it's been rebuilt. New counselors, new buildings, new everything...except for one man.

The new caretaker, Max Mason, was one of the last campers to stay at Wicakini. He survived the initial zombie onslaught, and then the government came and rescued him. He has sworn that what happened on that fateful day almost exactly 5 years ago would never happen again, and this time, he's prepared.

Unfortunately, the blight of Camp Wicakini, Wanagi Mato, is also prepared, and has been plotting revenge for 5 years...

This sandbox style adventure follows the first Camp Wicakini adventures. The camp has been completely rebuilt, but in true slasher-film style, it's been rebuilt exactly the way it was. There's a few twists on this one, and unlike the first two which were campy (pardon the pun) this one is straight up horror survival.

There is a new addition to the grounds, a Ranger Station, put up by the government to help monitor any suspicious activity.

Maps have graciously been included by Fabled Environments once again, and this adventure is completely compatible with the map pack from Camp Wicakini: Part II (Savage Worlds Edition)!

Get in there and survive! This adventure is the perfect follow up for the first two adventures, and it's ideal for conventions or a quick pick-up game, with pre-generated characters, equipment lists, and everything you need to run it the second you pick it up!

139105.name: Mini Torpedo Game
139105.description:
Cheap and cheerful game featuring a plastic board with a 'gun' in two corners. Each player takes 3 balls and 2 ships and sets up his ships in the notches for FLAG SHIP and 2nd SHIP as shown on the box. Then each player takes 3 torpedoes (ball-bearings) for his gun.

Each player places a ball inside his torpedo as shown on the box. He moves the torpedo to the right or left to aim the shot in the desired direction and then presses the trigger to release the ball.

Each player, in turn, gets to shoot three times, trying to knock down the ships of his opponent. Knocking over a FLAG SHIP scores 30 points, knocking over the 2nd SHIP scores 10 points. The player with the highest score wins. A perfect score is 40.

139106.name: More Well-known Advertisements
139106.description:
Party game that features some nice nostalgic British advertisements.

The host puts the 18 advert cards around the room and each player gets a card to record their answers. When the host thinks that enough time has gone by, he calls 'Time'. Everyone hands their answer sheet in and the one with the most correct answers wins.

Products featured mix well-known with obscure (to modern minds anyway).

139107.name: Grübel-Grübel
139107.description:
Objective:
gain most victory point finding matching terms
- acting by turns -
like in a quiz active player is challenged to find - as fast as possible - seven matching terms for a give task
the noise of the clock does not really a relaxing sphere..

139108.name: 3 Dice
139108.description:
Designer's comment:
Choose Your Own Adventure gamebooks are wonderful things. They contain little paragraphs scattered across the pages in a seemingly chaotic order, each one ending with a set of choices and numbers which take you flicking through the book to the next paragraph in your personal journey through the book.

Which got me thinking. What happens if you make those numbers actually mean something? What if they replaced the paragraphs themselves? And what if you made them random? What would a solitaire game like that be like?

This.

3 Dice

A CYOA solitaire game using just 3 dice and no gamebook

User comment:
This simple solitaire adventure game with dice was a submission for the RPG Solitaire Challenge.

The game is played by rolling three differently coloured six-sided dice. Using a single die 3 characteristics are rolled and recorded to represent your abilities. To begin playing the three dice are rolled and each die is referenced against a three column table to determine a location, a monster and a reward.

If a monster exists a die is rolled to determine combat results. If you win the encounter or the room is empty you total the room dice and record the total as your Experience Reward. When 50 points have been gained the adventure is over and abilities are reset to their starting values. Experience can be used to increase an ability by 1 point.

139109.name: Comic-Cars Walt Disney Grand Prix
139109.description:
"Preparations"

Next to start the first game, you have to carefully remove the figurines carved in cartons, which are then inserted in the transparent base. Each participant chooses prpopria figurine.
All figurines are placed on the starting.

"Goal of the game"
The aim of game is to get there the first to finish with your cards.

"Rules of the Game"

The youngest player starts the game, and pulls dice first. The figurines are moved so many square, how many points are made with dice: If a player has pulled a "five", cause to your figurine of five steps. If a player arrives with his figurine on a square occupied by the figure of a player, they can be reached both on the square; Then we go on a square can stay two or more figures, without one should "go away" or "eliminate" other.
But that's not all, because when they leave Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck and company, there is always something! There are, for example, the red square, coming on as you always have surprises.
When a figure at the end of its move, it stops on one of these "red square", you will immediately carry out the provisions it has prescribed.
The eight red square have the following meaning:

Square 4: you forgot to pay "entry in the race!" Get back to square one! when it reaches your next turn, you will have to start over.

Square 9: What a disgrace! You have a flat tire! To replace the wheel must remain stationary for a turn to play!

Square 13: Due to the great nervous tension, you went off the track and forced to follow the path of emergency marked with orange. To square 22 can finally get back on track and continue running normally.

Square 17: As every driver intelligent and well informed, you are able to skillfully exploit the wake of the other players. So roll the dice again.

Square 24: are you afraid of this journey full of twists and you're forced to slow down. You may proceed only if the dice with one or two shots

Square 32: too fast! You drifter and lost valuable time. You can re-rolling the dice only when you passed by at least one competitor. If you are already in last place, then you can proceed to the game normally.

Square 35: other drawbacks! Always proceeding at full throttle, you have used too much fuel and your tank is now empty. To refuel you are forced to stop in the pits for a turn.

"End of the game"
The player who first comes to Goal with his figurine won the game. It is not necessary to come and stop right on the destination square, if the score of the dice is higher than necessary, unnecessary steps are not counted.
The game continues until the last competitor has crossed the finish line.

139110.name: România (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride: Europe)
139110.description: To play, you either need to have the original Ticket to Ride or Ticket to Ride Europe. The Romania map can be played with either rule set and components, but is preferable to play with the Ticket to Ride: Switzerland rules.

139111.description:
This expansion requires the Asteroid Junkies! game to play, but includes all parts needed to play with five or six players!
BONUS: A new set of rules provides different variants for more options when playing Asteroid Junkies.
boardgameversion: The Game Crafter English First Edition
139111.name: Asteroid Junkies! 5-6 player expansion

139112.name: The Maintenance Mummy
139112.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in the shadow of Mount Terror lies the Tomb of Zuul-Tem. It has remained undisturbed for a thousand years, haunted by the cures of the ancient Necromancer who was supposedly laid to rest there. His knowledge, his treasure, and his power are said to be there with him. You and your group have planned an expedition there; an untouched crypt for a millennium. It is said to be trapped with devices of such lethal cunning that most men will die of fright. And it’s yours for the taking!

Yeah right.

It takes effort to make sure that all of the treasure stays put and the legend of the crypt stays intact. Traps need to be reset, and that is a huge undertaking. Even trying to do it by hand subjects the owner to the trap inside. Thus, the Maintenance Mummy was created.

With stats for the Savage Worlds, Ingenium, and Æther systems, this whimsical addition to a dungeon solves a long-time question in fantasy role-playing: how is everything still even working?

139113.name: Non-Traps
139113.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wonder what's worse than filling a dungeon with diabolical traps made to maim and kill the PCs? How about a dungeon filled with things that are meant to look like diabolical traps but are no more dangerous than a declawed house cat? In this third installement of our Diabolical Traps series, there are 15 of these non-traps that are detailed for use in any game system! From the confusing False Alarm to the maddening Flashing Sign, a full barage of these non-traps are waiting to be unleashed upon your unsuspecting PCs!

Get it today! Here's what's inside:

18 pages of detailing 15 traps
Creator notes from Akkhad-ibn-Akhan the Alchemist
Fully book marked for your ease of use
Fully compatible with any game system you choose to use
And so much more!

139114.name: Dozey's Dozy Day
139114.description:
A game for very young children. It appeared in the Playhour Annual in 1973. It 'stars' a character called Dozey Dormouse.

Use counters and a die. Move according to your roll. If you land on one of the seven Dozey illustrations, miss a turn "for a doze".

The first player to reach space 53, wins.

139115.name: Skeletons
139115.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is the first in a 12-book series of traps focusing on the ideas of three evil-doers. Fifteen traps are discussed mechanically with a designer's note as to successes, failures, and modifications of the traps in this 26 page volume. With art provided by Brian Brinlee, Ben Overmyer, and Kevin Rohan, each trap has a unique artistic depiction.

Lists examples for its skeletons in the Savage Worlds, Æther, and Ingenium systems
Easy to incorporate traps designed to annoy, maim, or murder those pesky PCs
Written from the perspective of bad guys that want to win!




Get it today to have fun with those pesky do-gooders as they rampage through your lairs!

139116.name: Rooms
139116.description:
From publisher blurb:

The follow up to our smash-hit Diabolical Traps - Skeleton Traps brings you new and exciting traps based on entire rooms! Fifteen traps are presented, from the cunning to the campy, from the Dicer to the Endless Hallway. Each of them are beautifully illustrated by our featured artist, Brian Brinlee, and each also has an accompanying sample floor plan to make them even faster and easier to drop into your dungeon crawl!

This 33 page book is written from the mind of the evil master artificer, Khankar. Each trap has text from him discussing uses, possible modifications, and relating stories of watching adventurers go through them, or even use them against the monsters in the dungeon later on. Also included is introductory text from the trapsmith, getting you in the mood to get these traps in your games!

This book is multi-stated for the Æther, Ingenium, and Savage Worlds rules systems, giving you concrete examples of damage and other statistics to put them into those systems or any other system of your choice. What are you waiting for? Get your hands on these beauties today and inflict them on your players at your whim!

Diabolical Traps - Rooms contains:

Fifteen fully detailed traps with descriptions and details
Beautiful illustrations and maps for each trap in the book
Notes from the trap builder himself
Complete rules for each trap for the Savage Worlds System
Complete rules for each trap for the Æther System
Complete rules for each trap for the Ingenium system
Hours of fun for GMs and frustration for players!

139117.name: Diva
139117.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a rookie agent to drop into your campaign, or just to drop in as an addition to a weekend gaming session? Well I have the young rookie agent for you.

A young woman struggling with the decision to go the route of being an athlete, a music major with a scholarship, or discovering a dream job purely by accident. Oh by the way, having parents who were active Superheroes makes this decision all the more easy, right? Have fun.

139118.name: Tenra Bansho Zero
rpghonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2014 ENnie for Best Production Values - Nominee
139118.description:
From the back cover

TENRA BANSHO ZERO: TALES OF HEAVEN AND EARTH

In the Hour of the Ox, a shinobi clan attacked a village under the protection of your regent. No one was left alive. The regent raised her hand and four emerged from the shadows to hunt down the clan and sever the hand that controls them:


"Ten Blade" Saburo, a cynical but skilled samurai of great renown. The magical red soulgems implanted all over his body allow him to gain incredible muscle, speed and clarity in battle.
Princess Rasen the armour-rider, the thirteen-year-old daughter of the regent. She pilots Red Hare, a 3-meter-tall mecha killing machine fueled by her innocence.
Sha-Lazt the Broken Cloud, a persecuted Phoenix Order monk of the indigenous spiritual oni race, whose hands are the ultimate tools of both healing and destruction.
Emerald Light, a geisha of high breeding and talent, who can enter the dreams of others. Her secret: She is actually a kugutsu mannequin, a doll carved from a sacred tree and given life.


Tenra Bansho Zero is a story-focused role-playing game of epic drama and insane action, set in the world of Tenra: A rich world of high magic and technology, of the ancient side by side with the futuristic. A world of blood and steel, mired in an endless feudal war. There are over a dozen playable character types in the game, including mecha-pilot armour riders, soulgem-studded samurai, onmyoji taoist sorcerers, Buddhist monks of three different orders, skilled shinobi, kijin cyborgs, peerless killing robots, secretive Shinto agents, mysterious ayakashi monsters and more!

Tenra Bansho Zero is easy to learn: With some friends, some six-sided dice and a drive for drama, you'll be engaged in a system that not only rewards dramatic role-playing with character power-ups, but also follows the dramatic structure of an anime series or kabuki play! It is also a fast-paced game: In just one session you can tell a complete story with your friends from start to finish.

Designed and illustrated by master Japanese game designer and manga artist Junichi Inoue, with illustrations by professional manga artists Hayami Rasenjin, Hiroyuki Ishida, and more! Tenra Bansho Zero is fully translated into English and features over 300 unique illustrations and 30 full color plates designed to visually bring new players into the unique world of Tenra. As the easy-to-learn rules are illustrated through several manga, and the rules feature tons of advice and references for players, you will be playing this game with your friends in no time!

EXPERIENCE THE ROLE-PLAYING GAME THAT STARTED A REVOLUTION IN JAPAN, NOW FINALLY AVAILABLE IN ENGLISH!

139119.name: Strand
139119.description:
From publisher blurb:

STRAND!!

Need a burglar with new schtick? Then Strand may be the criminal you're looking for! Gifted with prehensile hair, she's become a crook-for-hire that specializes in burglary.

139120.name: SteamPunk Alternate History
139120.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is Plate Mail Games' Hooks Throughout History 4: Steampunk Alternate Histories. Inside, you will find 100 hooks covering all of human history. These hooks can be used as one-shot games or added to ongoing campaigns. Also, check out my other Hooks Throughout History titles, which include horror, fantasy, and space hooks for your campaign.

Imagine if Archimedes had invented a steam engine in 226 BCE, and it spurred a technological boom sending Earth’s history on a radically different course. These hooks can be a springboard to a much bigger campaign where steam power runs the world and conquers space. You can use the hooks to intergrate steam power into many different cultures.

This product can be used with any role-playing game.

139121.name: Bad Neighbors
139121.description:
In Bad Neighbors, the goal is to kill all of your neighbors by inflicting various monsters on them, including zombies, vampires, aliens, and demons. Unfortunately, the neighbors are often prepared with weapons (including shotguns, holy water, machetes, stakes, and more). The game's art is humorous, parodying pop-horror icons from TV and movies (e.g. Buffy, Star Trek, Dawn of the Dead, etc).

Game-play: On your turn, you can attack any other player with a monster card. If the defending player has a matching weapon, they equip that weapon by placing it under a living family member card and remain safe. For instance, if you attacked with "hell mutt" (a demon) and they equip "holy water" (an anti-demon weapon), they're safe. Otherwise, the defender must choose one of their family members to perish. Flip that card over, revealing a gravestone.

If you can't or don't attack, you may play an action card or discard to refresh your hand. At the end of your turn, you refill your hand to 4 cards.

There are two ways to win: 1) kill all your neighbors; 2) equip your family with all 4 kinds (suits) of weapon.

139122.name: WarBirds III: Fighter Pilot Academy
videogameversion: North American Windows and Macintosh edition
139122.description:
Back of Box

"Best Online Simulation..." - Simulation News

Warbirds III: Fighter Pilot Academy, is one of the most highly praised massively multiplayer combat simulation games in the world! It has been named "Simulation of the Year" around the world since 1997!

Experience realistic training for air, ground and sea missions. Once you have mastered the training exercises and practice battles, go online with real players from around the world and engage in re-creations of real World War II air, land and sea battles in a massively multiplayer virtual battlefield.

Experience the thrill of going head-to-head with the enemy--in the air, on land and over sea. Battle with over 65 different airplanes, tanks and ships in online multiplayer arenas where hundreds of other players dog-fight, bomb, shoot and destroy enemy targets while defending their own territory.

The most exciting simulation in the world!


Train in realistic offline missions
Historically accurate models with over 42 aircraft, 10 bombers, 4 tanks, 4 ground vehicles and 4 ships
Thousands can play online in a massively multiplayer virtual World War II battlefield
Unparalleled realism of terrain detail, taken from real world satellite data
Groundbreaking physics and revolutionary special effects

139123.name: TrackMania² Stadium
139123.description:
User Summary

TrackMania² Stadium is the second environment of the TrackMania² series. It also marks the return of the Stadium environment from TrackMania Nations (Forever).

In addition to the regular single-player and multiplayer modes, and the modular track editor that is a hallmark of the series, TrackMania² Stadium also supports the creation of custom game modes.

139124.name: Divorce Wars
139124.description: In turn, a player moves one's pawn to the next unoccupied interesection ar corner. When a player reaches The Attorney, The Kids, The Shrink, The Dating Scene, or The Court that player draws an Experience CArd to see if that player will be awarded a Milestone. The player who collects a Milestone from each area and reachs the "You're a Winner" area is the victor.

139125.name: Hunt for the Ragnarok
139125.description:
Hunt for the Ragnarok is a hidden movement board game for 2-5 players in which one player takes the role of the last heir of a fallen galactic empire fleeing for his life and title aboard the freighter Ragnarok while the rebellious nobles houses pursue.
The desperate and damaged Ragnarok must cross the vast reaches of space - avoiding other inhabited worlds and using stealth and deception to avoid capture. The other players, acting as ships of the rebellious nobles, search for the Ragnarok - each seeking to be the first to find the heir and strengthen their own claim to the title before one of the others can do the same.

The Ragnarok has limited resources and moves slowly. It must rely on deception, misdirection and stealth to avoid the ships of the opposing players.
The Hunters ships have more options for movement, but find tracking the Ragnarok to be the challenge. As they move, they scan space around them and receive data back from the Ragnarok player in the form of cards.
Each Hunter only receives the data derived from their own ship sensors. Since they are working primarily for their own victory and not the collective victory of the Hunters.
Hunters also have access to a once per game power which is derived from a list initially communally available, but each power is removed from the game as it is used.

The Ragnarok wins the game if he can cross a large portion of the board and reach his destination planet.
The Hunter who finds Ragnarok wins the game and claims title to the throne of the empire.

The game includes a variable board set-up, specific scenario set-ups, advanced and optional rules and play formats.

Hunt for the Ragnarok finished second in the 2012 KublaCon Game Design Contest.

139126.name: Power Grip Rechargable Battery
139126.description:
From the box

Never charge your Game Boy Color again!

- Provides over 10 hours of continuous game play with one charge
- Unique shape provides better grip and added comfort for extended game play
- includes UL approved 120V AC Adapter/Charger
- Free Collector's Time Boy clock key chain with Power Grip

139127.name: Intelli Wars
139127.description:
INTELLI WARS is an operational level strategy space game where you manage fleets of spaceships and spend available resources to attack and conquer your opponent’s star systems by deciding when to commit your forces, where they must go and with what support while repairing, refitting and bringing in reinforcements.

It is a 2 player, competitive, turn based, card driven, strategy board game. This is a science fiction war setting between two space empires. The map is a blank hex grid to allow for various scenarios and thus increase replay value. Players are in the role of fleet commanders in charge of a theater of war with a God’s eye point of view. The scope is that of a campaign operation; events are just part of the wider war.

A unit represents a fleet of spaceships and while the time scale is abstract a turn is meant to represent anywhere from a few weeks to a couple of months. To win you must achieve the scenario's victory point level.

The game in its current format is print & play and files are provided in this page for downloading components and rules in electronic format for printing and assembling.

Components:

An 11" x 17" map sheet.
40 x 5/8" square counters.
24 x 3/4" square counters.
2 x sets of 24 cards, one set per faction (48 cards total).
2 x double printed scenario cards.
2 x double sided play mats.
1 x 8 page Rulebook.

139128.name: Light Shield
139128.description:
User Summary

Lights, Protects, Stores

The Pelican Light Shield for Game Boy Pocket and Game Boy Color can be stored directly on the device. When closed, it protects the screen from scratches. The shield folds up and lights the game screen for nighttime play or reduce glare during daytime play. The shield can also store a Game Boy cartridge.

139129.name: WarBirds
139129.description:
WarBirds is a massively multiplayer online and offline World War II simulation, published by iEntertainment Network. The game includes an air combat flight simulator as well as a simulator for tanks and other ground vehicles. The WarBirds series inspired a fan following, conventions and a book titled WarBirds: The Story so far.

Source: Wikipedia, "WarBirds", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

139130.name: WarBirds II
139130.description:
WarBirds is a massively multiplayer online and offline World War II simulation, published by iEntertainment Network. The game includes an air combat flight simulator as well as a simulator for tanks and other ground vehicles. WarBirds was originally developed in 1995 (as Confirmed Kill) by Interactive Creations of Grapevine and inspired a fan following, conventions and a book titled WarBirds: The Story so far.

Source: Wikipedia, "WarBirds", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgameintegration: Hoplomachus: Crowd Favor Gladiator Promo Chips
Hoplomachus: Crowd Favor Gladiator Promo Chips
139131.description:
Hoplomachus [ha-ploh-ma-kuss], or "Hoplo" for short, is a hex-based tactical board game set inside a gladiatorial arena. One to three players, each representing an ancient city/civilization thought to have been lost to the world, are now on Rome's doorstep vying for a place in the prestigious arena games.

Players have a very clear objective: Eliminate the opponent's champion. Champions start the game in the arena but are inactive and defenseless. They will not fight until the crowd is behind them. Each player takes turns drawing, playing and moving gladiators from their "hand" and assisting them with tactic chips.

Based on opponent's moves and play style, each person will need to adjust their strategies. Defend your champ, take over and hold the crowd favor areas, assault opponent's champion, cover deployment zones, eliminate tacticians to reduce enemy options, fight beasts to gain crowd favor, the list of tactical possibilities is endless.

Hoplomachus combines combat, tactics, chip (units) management, level progression (though crowd favor system), team play, player vs board, and so much more.
139131.name: Hoplomachus: Rise of Rome

139132.name: Gargoyle
139132.description:
User Summary

In Gargoyle, elves are working to retrieve their gold from their castle's throne room, which a hoard of gargoyles has invaded. The gargoyles send fireballs their way, which must be doused with a bucket of water before the elves can move forward.
Rubies will enlarge the bucket, while rocks halve it.

139133.name: Gargoyle Revenge
139133.description:
User Summary

In the sequel to Gargoyle, the gargoyles have become even more malign: they are now tossing the remaining elves from the castle towers!
The player must rescue the falling elves using a movable trampoline, which bounces the elves to another height according to how high they fell from before landing safely in a hay wagon.

139134.name: Gargoyle Mania
139134.description:
User Summary

In the final instalment of the Gargoyle Trilogy, the gargoyles bombard the retreating elves with rocks. The elves attempt to shoot down the beasts with their bows. As the gargoyles are dispatched, some may drop coins, potions, and other treasures which aid the elves in their fight.
Between each stage, improvements to the elven weaponry or defenses may be purchased. Boss fights end the levels as well, adding to the challenge.

139135.name: Tramp Stamp
139135.description:
From the rules:
All your characters work at the same tattoo parlor. Name it. The tattoo parlor will be closing in three days. You’ll have those three days to either get a hot tattoo job, get out of the tattoo lifestyle, or fail miserably.

User note:
According to the introduction, Tramp Stamp was written in 24 hours at GenCon 2010.

139136.name: Jane's USNF: Final Mission
139136.description:
User Summary

A Japanese update of USNF '97. This version featured a new campaign set in Japan, new audio content and additional scenery.

139137.description:
Firefly: Out to the Black is a quick card game that plays from three to five players. It’s unusual in that the players do not compete against each other, but compete against the game. This is a fairly new style of game called a co-op game or cooperative game. Players take on roles of the crew of Serenity and play through a series of Events. Using their Fightin’, Flyin’, and Thinkin’ skills they attempt to successfully complete these Events to earn Credits and Honor. If the players run out of Credits or Honor before the end of the game, they all lose and the game wins! If the players manage to complete the predetermined amount of Events without running out of Credits or Honor, they win the game, and live to fly another day!

Components:

Double sized Character Cards – Contains the Character’s Skill numbers and special abilities

Event Cards – These are the Events the players must overcome to win the game.

Serenity Cards – These are dual use cards. The main use is to help the players overcome Events. It’s secondary use is to determine random numbers.

Alliance Cards – These are penalty cards that are drawn if the players do not do well at certain Events. Draw too many of these and the players lose the game even if they still have Credits and Honor.

Gorramit Cards – These cards modify the Events, generally making them harder.
A Set of Rules – The rules to the game.
Honor Tokens – These are used to track the player’s Honor.
Credit Tokens – These are used to track the player’s Credits.

The Character Cards each represent one of the main Characters in Firefly. In addition to having their skills values listed, Each Character has special abilities, which cost a variable amount of Credits or Honor. On a players turn he can choose to spend Credits or Honor on one of these abilities, but it brings them closer to losing, so they need to think about whether they really need to or not.

A typical turn of the game consists of the active player turning over the top Event card. Each Event card has three challenges, one Fightin’, one Flyin’, and one Thinkin’. Each of these has a number, which the players must equal or exceed to be successful in the challenge. Characters gain skill two different ways, they may play Serenity cards to gain skill, and, after playing their Serenity cards, they add a random number to determine their final skill. This is added to the Character’s base skill number listed on their Character cards. Depending on how many challenges they successfully complete they either gain or lose Credits and/or Honor. The more successful the more they gain.

Once the event is resolved, the next player starts a new turn, and turns over the next Event card. The game is over once all the Event cards have been drawn and resolved.

The Firefly TV show is about surviving with honor. Mal and his crew are continually trying to scrounge up enough credits to keep flying, while maintaining their own personal sense of honor. The game reflects this grand theme with the victory conditions, survive the Event deck without running out of Honor or Credits. Each Event in the deck is tied to an episode in the show, and is easily recognizable by fans of the show. The Skills needed for each Event are tied to action of the episode featured on the card. A sub theme of the show is escaping notice of the Alliance, and again, with the inclusion of the Alliance deck, Firefly: Out to the Black delivers. The Alliance deck is an ever-present threat looming over the players as they desperately seek to finish the Events in the game.
139137.name: Firefly: Out to the Black
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! Episode 49: 2013 in review
Strange Assembly 125 - The Horror (Brain Burn)

139138.name: Beacon (v5.x)
139138.description:
From the Introduction:
Welcome to the Beacon fantasy role-playing
system.

Beacon started out with my desire to build a fast and fun fantasy RPG that I could play with my kids and my friends. In the past I played my share of RPGs and had made my share of house rules, however on returning to the hobby I wanted to simplify things. Keep the game fast and fun like it was in the olden times. I latched onto Microlite d20 for its clean and simple rules, but also for its basic compatibility with the large amount of material published for d20 systems such as 3rd edition Dungeons and Dragons. Microlite was great… but I wanted a little more under the hood.

What’s different?

Beacon has its origins in Microlite d20 and shares some features of that system, namely;
 Magic based on a hit point based system.
 Simple and fast combat system.
 Streamlined stats and character classes.
A simple but effective skill system that allows the players and GM to base results on how a task is described.

In addition Beacon has its own spin on things such as:
 Simple but robust class advancement;
 Spells modified for point based casting;
 A simple phased combat system;
 A critical hit/fumble table for magic and combat;
 Streamlined monster statistics.
 A silver based money standard; and
 Druids are hedge magey magic users and not clerics!

139139.description:
Drum Roll: Fire Dancer is a promotional card available at Spiel 2013. The Fire Dancer belongs to a new performer type called "Oriental".
Also available during the Drum Roll kickstarter reprint campaign
139139.name: Drum Roll: Fire Dancer

139140.description:

Included:

4x End Show/End Game Prestige cards*
5x Bargain Investment cards
5x Provisions Investment cards

139141.name: Pro Strategy Football 2012
139141.description: A football strategy game for iOS.

139142.name: Jumbo's Jolly Trunk Game
139142.description:
Yery young children's game from the Playhour Annual, 1984.

All players begin on the eye illustration. You must thow a six to start and then it is the first to reach the end of the trunk (square number 40), wins.

139143.name: The Train Race Game
139143.description:
Young children's game from the Playhour Annual 1984.

You can join this race with counters and dice! Choose to be either Sam Steam train or Digby Diesel. Throw the dice and move your counter along the track the number of spaces shown on the dice. If a player's counter lands on a red space, that player misses a turn. When you reach the middle of the track you can go either way round to avoid a crash. The one to reach the other end of the track first is the winner.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Game Rules Supplement Nominee
139144.description:
From publisher website:

"From covert actions against insurgent groups and daring sabotage missions to precision strikes against fortified positions and reconnaissance deep behind enemy lines, the special forces units deployed by many nations are the spearhead of modern combat operations. "Classified", the latest companion volume for Force on Force, allows wargamers to recreate any and all of them. With detailed background information, extensive orders of battle for the world's preeminent special forces units, and a range of scenarios, "Classified" gives Force on Force players a detailed and realistic experience of modern special operations missions across the globe."
139144.name: Classified: Special Operations Missions 1940-2010

139145.description:
From the publisher website:

"In 1812, after a period of considerable victories, Napoleon found himself fighting on two fronts, suffering setback after setback. With his forces in Spain being pushed back, Napoleon launched an invasion of his former ally, Russia, leading the half-million-strong Grande Armee to Moscow and a brutal defeat at the hands of Russian forces and the bitter winter. On the defensive, Napoleon was defeated and exiled, but returned to lead his loyal armies against a coalition of European nations in a final campaign that culminated at Waterloo. "Triumph of Nations", a companion for "Field of Glory Napoleonic", provides players with all the army lists and details they need to recreate the battles of the later Empire, from the disastrous invasion of Russia to the glorious Hundred Days."
139145.name: Field of Glory Napoleonic: Triumph of Nations

139146.name: Happy Families Thrive on Cadburys Bournville Cocoa
139146.description:
Cadbury advert/game from The Champion Annual for Boys in 1950. At this time, Cadbury often used the back of children's annuals to advertise and they nearly always liked to make it a game as well.

HOW TO PLAY: All you need to play this game is a dice, together with a dice cup (an egg-cup will do) and some coloured counters or buttons, one for each player. The game can be played by any number of players, and the first player to reach 80 and get into ‘bed’ is the winner. Don't forget that you must obey any instructions that you land on. With your last throw you must get the exact number to reach 80: if you throw too high a number you must wait for another turn.

Cadburys, the makers of Bournville Cocoa, hope you will have a lot of fun with this game, and that Mummy will always give you plenty of lovely chocolatey Bournville Cocoa to help you to grow up healthy and strong.

139147.description:
Central Italy in the year 753 B.C.: Many new villages have been founded in the region of Latium. This land is prosperous and a strong city here can easily control the trades between the Etruscan cities of the North and the Greek colonies of the South. The region is also rich in salt ponds, and the salt in this period is worth more than gold. There doesn't exist a better place for a new city!

The two grandsons of the King of Albalonga – the twins Romolo and Remo, descendants of Enea of Troy – don't want to miss an opportunity to dominate the region and, acting against each other, try to establish two cities close to the Tiber river. Their enterprise is not easy as the King of Antemnae and the King of Crustumerium will also fight to dominate this area! Who will prevail?

In Romolo o Remo?, players act as Kings of the new cities in the Latium and have to compete with each other in order to gain control of the whole Region. Players must manage their kingdom and their growing settlement. Two aspects are crucial: the citizens, as players act with citizens to take many different actions, and the territory, as players can act only in the territories they are able to control – excluding when they go to war, of course! If the population grows, they can take more actions, but they must feed all of them as well. Money, resources, trades, city buildings, and specialized characters increase a player's possibilites, and soldiers, mercenaries, and war declarations can change the game's storyline at any moment. Who will able to build the strongest city? Who will be the founder of a new civilization – or perhaps even an Empire?
139147.name: Romolo o Remo?

139148.name: CityProGame Bremen
139148.description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Bremen each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

The same game, placed in Berlin is called "Gesellschaftsspiel Berlin" (see separate entry).

139149.name: CityProGame Kassel
139149.description:

139151.description:

139154.name: KiCKran
139154.description:
objective: score as many goals as possible - two versions:
1.
- acting until you score or ball is taken off -
roll one die (or two - depending on the coloured area) and move the ball straightforward; if your die shows a '1' draw an event card instead (possibility for penalty, corner..). Combat-cards can be used for a counterattack. If Ball is shot on target you can score a goal.

2.
- acting until you score or ball is taken off -
no dice - 6 movement points per turn - + combat-cards instead;
no event cards are drawn: a bit more tactical;

Game can be played with 2 persons or two teams

139155.name: The Beggar's Opera
139155.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Beggar's Opera is an experimental game based on John Gay's opera of the same name. Six people play Macheath and the Peachums and Lockits, and a seventh sorts their contributions into a coherent narrative.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
139156.name: Khas Fara
139156.description:
From the publisher's website:

A system-less fantasy adventure setting with some pre-made characters for Solar System/Shadow of Yesterday. Was honored in a contest and appeared in Fight On! magazine.

139158.name: Moron Trivia
139158.description:
Trivia game full of questions with obvious answers. Example:

Q. In what straits is the Rock of Gibralter situated?
A. Straits of Gibralter

Play until you are all fed up and the one with the most right answers, wins.

139159.description:
In the madcap and chaotic card game Meerkat Slammers, the meerkat tribe has lost its leader and descended into anarchy as each competing faction is determined to prove it's the best! Not all meerkats fight fair, though, and players can employ a number of dirty tricks in order to get one up on his rivals.

At the start of the game, each player is dealt 15 cards in five piles, one card in the first pile, two in the second, and so on. Turn the top card of each pile face up, then place the rest of the deck face down in the middle of the playing area. Someone flips over the topmost card of the deck to create the discard pile, then the chaos begins. Every meerkat clan card features a fighting score. You may place any of your face-up cards on the discard pile so long as its fighting score is one below or one above the number of the topmost card on the discard pile. Once you play a card, you can turn over the topmost card of the pile from which it came. In addition, you can always have five individual piles, so if one pile empties, move any face-up card from an existing pile to create a new one.

Event cards can be played at any time. Slam them down next to the discard pile and shout the name of the card. Play stops so that the event instructions can be carried out, after which a new round begins.

The objective is to get rid of all your cards. This alone, however, is not enough to claim victory as many potential clan leaders have come undone at the last moment. As soon as a player is rid of his last card, any player may slam his palm down on the discard pile to claim the victory.
139159.name: Meerkat Slammers

139160.description: Player Board created by Stefan Feld exclusively for the regional qualifying round of the German board game championship 2013.
139160.name: The Castles of Burgundy: 3rd Expansion – German Board Game Championship Board 2013

139161.name: Hello Sunshine!
139161.description:
Hello Sunshine! is a charmingly simple game that will have you and your child laughing and playing together! Play hide and seek with Sunshine – an adorable plush toy – while teaching your child positional words such as: In, On Top, Below, Next To, and more.

Game Play:
1. Grown-up selects a card and hides the plush Sunshine according to the card.
2. Grown-up shows child the card and says, "Can you find Sunshine ______ ?" (example, UNDER the table)
3. When child finds Sunshine, everyone celebrates!
4. Try another card.

139162.name: Zingo! Sight Words
139162.description:
Teaches Words that are Essential to Reading!
Zingo! Sight Words is a fun and interactive word game that brings fast-paced excitement and learning to the classic game of Bingo! Players learn to quickly recognize and read sight words, which are words with spelling that is not always straightforward. Sight words are the most frequently used words in the English language and make up about 50 - 75 % of all written material. Learning and mastering sight words is a key step in becoming a successful, fluent reader. The sight words used in this game have been specially selected by leading educators as the most fundamental for reading development.

Grades Pre-K - 1

139163.description:
This expansion includes four new cards. Two of them are so called color changer. These are two new travel cards.
Additionally two new adventure cards (with the color changer symbol) - Leopoldville & Addis Abeba are included.

These expansion is included in the Abacus Katalog-Edition 13 and was printed on high quality paper. This guarantees a perfect fit to the base game.
139163.name: Africana: Die Farbwechsler

139164.name: The Slave Pits of Abhoth
139164.description:
From the introduction:
This project was inspired by the re-release of the core books of the Advanced version of the world’s most famous FRPG. At the time of the announcement, I was thrilled that these books were to be re-released; however, I personally would have preferred if the entire library had been made available in various forms. I was subsequently challenged to re-imagine one entry in the library rather than simply wait for that library to see the light of day. This module is my answer to that challenge — a re-imagined version of the first module in the classic A-series.

While this is written for the retro-clone Labyrinth Lord™ using the Advanced Edition Companion™ expansion and inspiration from The Realms of Crawling Chaos™, it is still easily used with the re-released core books with little to no conversion for those who are interested.

139165.name: The Caves of Cormakir the Conjurer
139165.description:
From the introduction:
This module was inspired by the re-release of the Moldvay Basic Edition of the world’s most famous FRPG and is the culmination of a project to imagine what that Basic Edition would look like had the monster section only included creatures found in my favorite folio of fiends (often referred to as the FF). Since the boxed set of the Moldvay Basic Edition came with the second installment of the B-series of adventure modules, it follows that I should re-image that introductory module as if it would have appeared in the FF version of the Moldvay Basic Edition.

This adventure is written for the retro-clone Labyrinth Lord™, an excellent emulation of the Moldvay Basic Edition. Therefore, this adventure is not only compatible with that edition, but requires almost no conversion to use with any of the older editions of the world’s most famous FRPG.

139166.name: Lotus Blossom's Bridal Path
139166.description:
From the introduction:

Lotus Blossom’s Bridal Path is a scenario for Tenra Bansho Zero in five acts, plus a Zero Act. It is intended to be played over the course of four to six hours, with each Act representing about an hour of gameplay.

The scenario is written for three to six players, but four or five are the optimal number. Six pregenerated player characters are included with this scenario, but you can your own characters if you and your players so desire.

139167.description:
This 16 page booklet was given out by Pegasus Spiele at the 2012 Essen SPIEL fair.

It contains several variants and scenarios for Thunderstone Advance.
139167.name: Thunderstone Advance: Towers of Ruin – Modules

139168.name: Tales of War
139168.description:
Publisher's blurb:
Welcome to the Tales of series! Tales of War is the first in a line of products that are created around the OpenD6 Gaming system. This issue of Tales of War re-introduces Nazi Fury, a vintage pulp-genre story by Lt. Scott Morgan. Also included is a Mini Six compatible adventure titled The Road to Rouen. This adventure takes the PCs on a mission to liberate a French scientist from the clutches of Nazi forces in occupied France, just as D-Day is about to begin. There are tons of weapons stats, vehicle stats, and some new rules to be had as well!

139169.name: Moonsurface Crater
139169.description:
From the Introduction:

To the untrained eye the moon's surface might look featureless and dreadfully monotonous. And it is true, that this crater is only one among many. Not even the smaller crater in its interior serves as a real distinguishing landmark. Part of the craters wall has started crumbling, which hints at a higher age. Rocks are strewn around the craters circumference and at one spot its wall has even collapsed into a crude ramp of a sort. Only if one looks closely it will become apparent that this collapse was by no means natural. The rocks making up the ramp still show the hard edges of recent mechanical processing.

139170.name: The Game In Last Appearances #4
139170.description:
designer synopsis

Three great superheroes threaten and insult and boast, determined to end each other’s romantic aspirations to the woman they all love.

139171.name: Coyote's Winter
139171.description:
designer synopsis

The characters are the last Coyotes, struggling to survive and adapt to human environment.

139172.name: The Crypt of Calamities
139172.description:
User summary:

The Crypt of Calamities is a two-page dungeon for the Delve RPG in which the PCs venture into a sorcerer's tomb.

139173.name: Coyotesong: a Game of Leaving
139173.description:
designer synopsis

A personal ritual game to play, with friends or alone, to say farewell to a place or context you are leaving.

139174.name: Year Walk
videogamehonor: 2013 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2014 British Academy Game Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
139174.description:
Experience the ancient Swedish phenomena of year walking through a different kind of first person adventure that blurs the line between two and three dimensions as well as reality and the supernatural.

Venture out into the dark woods where strange creatures roam, on a vision quest set in 19th century Sweden. Solve cryptic puzzles, touch and listen in your search to foresee the future and finally discover if your loved one will love you back.

Mysteries and clues await everywhere in Year Walk, but to fully understand the events that took place on that cold New Year's Eve, you will have to delve deeper than the adventure and lose yourself between fact and fiction.

Source: The Developer Website.

139175.name: One Last Night
139175.description:
designer synopsis

Ritual GM-less drinking RPG about characters on the cusp of an apocalypse pursuing their final desires.

139176.description:
In Wrong Chemistry, players want to collect as many points as they can by forming molecules based on the cards they draw. The expansion Wrong Chemistry: Expand Your Lab adds to the action of the base game, first by allowing for play with up to five players, and second by adding new element cards that expand upon the tactics of the base game by giving you new ways to earn points and by using both sides of the hex tiles.

In addition, new scientists have been added to the game; each player chooses one at the start of play and can use the power of this scientist up to three times during the game. Two new cards – "The Element of Surprise" and "Transmutium" – can be played in combination with the scientists to let you play during your rivals' turns.

Finally, five new cards – each worth 5 points – are placed face up on the table, waiting to be claimed by any player who can form these difficult combinations. As soon as the final card is claimed, the game ends – but the game can end in other ways as well as you'll discover during the game!
139176.name: Wrong Chemistry: Expand Your Lab

139177.description:
Every turn of Terrene Odyssey is the core of an intense JRPG battle! Defeat the enemy party in this competitive 1v1 and 2v2, all-inclusive battle card game modeled after the battle systems of 90's Video Game RPG's.

Choose from over 50 characters in 12 unique classes to create your perfect starting party strategy, then Command them into battle and equip them with Items to defeat the enemy. Level Up! your characters with the perfect Terrain Bonuses to adapt to new challenges and claim ultimate victory!

Jump right into battle with 1 of 6 included pre-constructed deck or customize your own with the 324 cards packed into the box!

Terrene Odyssey is all-inclusive--every card in the game comes in one box. No trading and no boosters!


NEW DRAFT RULES

A new format to play with 3 - 12 friends using the cards you already own!
This free update is available at www.TerreneOdyssey.com


2015 RULES UPDATE AND ERRATA

Game Rules have been updated for balance.
View or download the changes at www.TerreneOdyssey.com
139177.name: Terrene Odyssey
boardgamepodcastepisode: Mudslides and Pyroclastic Flow

139178.name: Wordical
139178.description:
From the web page:

The radical dice-rolling, word-building race!

Roll the vowel dice and combine the letters with the consonant cards in your hand—build the highest-scoring word and you win the round! 2–8 players. Grades 3+

139179.name: Like Moths...
139179.description:
designer synopsis

Dr. Moreau minions are fighting for survival within a twisted and deadly arena. Only the strongest will survive.

139180.name: EULA: the game
139180.description:
designer synopsis

World’s going to end – and no one gives a damn. You try to save humanity – but what would you do, if everything you have just... expires?

139181.description: French cartoonist Martin Vidberg gives you a new DIY monster ready to rampage Tokyo: beware LE GEEK!
139181.name: Le Geek (fan expansion to King of Tokyo)

139182.name: True Men Don't Kill Coyotes
139182.description:
designer synopsis

A game where you discover the sense that players gives to the murder, you perceive the interactions, and you explore the relativity.

139183.name: Coyote Doctor
139183.description:
designer synopsis

Godlike entities race against time to recover the Lantern in a dying universe, while the Coyote attempts to thwart them at every turn.

139184.name: Lantern, A Game of Entropy
139184.description:
designer synopsis

People trying to finish Bucket Lists in a universe contracted to the point that everything is huddled together, here at the end of entropy.

139185.name: Civscape
139185.description:
The ancient city-states of the Mediterranean constantly fought with one another for supremacy. Can you be the first civilization to achieve greatness?

In the Civscape card game, you will add Buildings to the Skyline of your city, discover new Technologies that are added to your City’s Timeline, establish new systems of Government, carefully balance your Resources and race against your rivals to build Wonders and Statues.

Each city-state is constantly pushing the limits of what it can sustain: a city grows larger than its technology supports, fields more military than it has resources for, and comes up with more plans than its current system of government can implement. Even as you expand your own city, you can cause trouble for other city states, subjecting them to calamities, disbanding their military, forcing them to choose new leaders, or seizing the crown of the Emperor.

You will play one of nine cities: Athens, Carthage, Corinth, Ephesus, Pella, Rome, Sparta, Syracuse or Thebes. Each city has 10 other corresponding cards, with a unique Wonder, Statue (great leader), other Buildings, Technology, Government, and Events. Prior to gameplay, each player selects their City and its cards, which are mixed together into the overall draw deck. Choose sets of rivals like the Peloponnesian War (Athens vs. Sparta and Thebes), the Punic War (Rome vs. Carthage), the League of Corinth (Pella & Corinth vs. Ephesus), the Sicilian War (Syracuse vs. Carthage) or one of the other suggested scenarios. With thousands of combinations, every game is different!

Download the free print-and-play PDF with all 108 cards.

139186.name: Scrapland Scramble
139186.description:
The airship marked a turning point in society. Now the skies were open to exploration, commerce, and illegal activity. The clouds became hiding places for Speakeasies, black market dealers, and much more unsavory activities. As a result, the Sky Patrol was created to help keep the peace. In an attempt to avoid being arrested during a recent “job”, you have accidentally wrecked your airship along with a few unlucky others. Fix your airship as quickly as possible to avoid certain incarceration!

On your turn, you roll dice trying to match them to a type of component (using simple icons). Once you know what it looks like, you search for a token that has the same icons, trying to recover a piece of your airship. Once recovered, airship components grant special abilities like making your turns easier or even griefing opponents.

Not all the tokens are useful. Most of the time, the player will select a token that is of no use to them and place it back in the pile. Memorization skills are necessary to ensure a player doesn't needless pick up the same token again and to remember where opponents have placed tokens the player needs. But with the special abilities that can be earned, the tokens can be shifted multiple times per game.

The first player to collect all of their tokens to complete their airship wins the game.

139187.name: The Last Call of the Totem Spirits
rpg: The Last Call of the Totem Spirits
139187.description:
designer synopsis

In the end of days, the last tribes must heed the call from the totem spirits and attempt to save creation from complete destruction.

139188.name: Advanced HeroQuest: Paint Set
139188.description:
The Advanced HeroQuest Paint set - Produced by Citadel Miniatures/Games Workshop in 1991 as an expansion for the Advanced Heroquest tabletop miniatures game.

A break down of the components are:
6 plastic "Fantasy Fighters" figures, with alternate heads and weapons (Wood Elf, Dark Elf, Orc, Goblin, Skaven, Dwarf).

4 plastic Advanced Heroquest Hero figures (Fighter, Mage, Elf, Dwarf).

8 plastic Skeleton figures.

13 plastic shields.

Plastic bases for all figures.

1 Citadel Miniatures painting guide.

A information sheet on using the additional characters in the Advanced HeroQuest game.

9 Citadel Colour paints: Black, White, Red, Blue, Green, Yellow, Bronzed Flesh, Brown, Silver.

1 Citadel Paint brush.

Details described from packaging/back of box, including "May present choking hazard. Not for children."

139189.name: Pitford: Gateway to the Ruins
139189.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to scenic Pitford: Gateway to the Ruins! This is your last stop before undertaking a dig in the nearby Great Ruins. Why not enjoy some of the fine services offered in this enclosed town? There are brothels, bars, massage parlors, shops, a casino and even a gladiatorial arena, all here for your delight. After all, this may be your last night in this twisted world, why not make it one to remember? Pitford is like a great immobile tank, stuck on the battle scarred, hostile plains in the shadow of the Great Ruins. This scrap metal enclosure is more than a home base for excavators; it is a dynamic adventure site, where opportunity, riches, espionage, crime, and debauchery await. Herein, game sessions are as challenging and deadly as anything found outside of its junk and concrete shell. The fortress-town stands as a frontier bastion for a hard pressed humanity, providing a retreat from the harsh sand storms and flesh eating mutated beasts of the wilds. With one road leading in at the south and another at the north, it is stopping place for travelers, outlaws, savages, scavs, runaways and most of all, excavators. For over eighty years this fort has served as a base camp for dig teams who loot the boundless ruinscape beyond, where the lucky make it back alive with artifacts of enormous wealth and power. This book is both a game master reference resource, as well as a guide for players whose characters are visiting the bustling, old west style boom town. Included are 56 shops and businesses, 33 streets and alleys, access points to the topside roof, and stairwells to the notorious basement level. In addition, fortress defenses, gatehouses, and town watch details are included, along with a robust section on the municipal jail with encounters for those incarcerated within. Also included are series of adventure hooks, appendices, map collections, the governing Association of Business Owners and the Freehold Scouts. Situated in the north east corner of the Crossroads Region, Pitford figures heavily in upcoming adventures published for The Mutant Epoch role-playing game. While having this book isn't necessary, it would enhance game play and provide details on resources adventurers need to recover, resupply, and recruit new excavators.

139191.name: Excavator Monthly Compendium
139191.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Now you can get all six copies of Excavator Monthly Magazine in one book! Each article, relic, mutant beast, non-player character and other feature has been placed into categories within this hefty tome. Never forget a copy again. Both game masters and players of The Mutant Epoch role playing game can carry all the magazines in one handy book and quickly flip to any resource with ease.

Excavator Monthly Compendium includes:
● 27 Nasty Mutant Creatures
● 13 Potent Relics
● 6 Alternate Character Generation Methods
● 2 New Skills: Acrobatics and Archery
● 12 Non-Player Character Friends and Foes
● 162 Illustrations
● 9 Assorted Articles
● Short Story: Demon in the Depths
● 10 Game Master Only Articles
● 8 Players Perspective Articles
● 4 Treasure Tables
● And much more!

139192.name: Most Likely To Succeed
139192.description:
designer synopsis

Burn your yearbook, alienate your friends, and go totally insane in this phantasmagoric soap-opera Sucker Punch x Battle Royale beat-em-up.

139193.name: Beasts & Barbarians: Beasts of the Dominions
139193.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The mysterious Moloke-tanu hunting in the tall grass of the Ivory Savannah... The Yellowfingers lurking in the darkest tombs of the Cairnlands... The Yarakan, or Great Devourers, dreaming memories of a fallen empire... Ten monsters of the Dread Sea Dominions, each with a dedicated Savage Tale, await you within. In addition, a Player Appendix to let you play the dreaded Disciples of the Black Temple! Grab your battleaxe, ready your bow, and prepare to face the Creatures of the Dread Sea Dominions! This book presents ten monsters and NPCs typical of the Dread Sea Dominions, complete with stats, descriptions, and a complete Heroic Tale you can use as a stand-alone adventure, or customize to fit your campaign. The scenarios are designed for a party of 4-6 Seasoned heroes, but you can alter them for more experienced groups. They can be played in any order, though some tales work better in the given sequence (check each tale's Requirements). Each scenario also includes a Hook, which you can use as inspiration for your own stories as well. Each group of foes is based in a different area of the Dominions and evenly distributed across the lands, giving your party opposition in each major nation of the setting. However, you can relocate them to countries work better for your campaign. In addition you find an Appendix, dedicated to players, to play the mysterious Disciples of the Black Temple, a sect of dark sorcerers with an even darker master. To use this compendium you need copies of the Savage Worlds and Beasts and Barbarians rulebooks.

139194.name: Little shark
139194.description: Up until now a squid and its friends - lots of little fish - have been playing happily together in the sea. However, a racy little shark has suddenly appeared and is circling this group of playmates. Luckily the squid is able to spread lots of ink ! Now we need your help ! Come and play together and help save the squid and its friends by covering the shark in so much ink, that it can't see properly. Because a shark that dissapears in a 'soup of ink' cannot be dangerous anymore ! The excitement begins: Is the shark going to eat up 9 little fishes first ? Or will the squid manage to squirt enough ink to save his friends first?

139195.name: Animal Jam
139195.description:
National Geographic Animal Jam is a massively multiplayer online game launched in 2010 by Smart Bomb Interactive, in partnership with the National Geographic Society. The game, "which has experienced 500% year-over-year growth," already has millions of registered players, and "is one of the fastest-growing online kids properties worldwide." Animal Jam is free from outside advertising and adheres to a strict privacy policy.

Animal Jam takes place in the world of Jamaa, where players can travel through various ecological environments. Each environment features different interactive facts, games, and virtual shops. Players are represented in the game with customizable animal avatars. Players can accessorize their avatars, decorate their dens, and adopt virtual pets. Players interact with one another through chatting, trading/gifting, or by participating in multiplayer games and parties. Players are rewarded with achievements for collecting facts in game, making friends, and decorating their dens. Players also earn the in-game currency, Gems, by completing games. Gems enable players to make in-game purchases of additional avatars, accessories, dens, and den items.

Source: Wikipedia, "National Geographic Animal Jam", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

139196.name: GobMan
139196.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pac-Man.





User SummaryGobMan is quite similar to PacMan; the circular hero moves about the level, eating dots and avoiding ghosts. The power 'pills' allow GobMan to consume the ghosts for extra points for the short period of time. Alongside this, however, is a host of powerups and special items that can be collected and used. For instance, with a certain item, walls can be moved through or destroyed.

139197.name: God of Thunder
139197.description:
User Summary

In God of Thunder, the protagonist, Thor, must rescue Midgard from the trickster, Loki. Odin has summoned the God of Thunder with his mighty hammer to dispose of this threat; however, Loki has placed obstacles and enemies in the way, impeding Thor's progress.
This puzzler pitches Thor into a small navigable world in which barriers and monsters abound. Thor's hammer can be thrown and will always return to him, though it is not always capable in destroying an enemy.

139198.name: Sudden Death: Ninja Attack
139198.description:
A game for 2 players, simulating two ninjas dueling to the death in a bamboo forest. Players use attack cards, action cards and withdrawal cards as they fight and withdraw until there is only one ninja left standing... or none.

The deck consists of 25 unique cards. Attacks are played in a rock-paper-scissors fashion, with Melee attacks countering Ranged, Ranged attacks countering Traps, and Traps countering Melee attacks. Attacks continue until either one player cannot counter (they die) or an appropriate withdraw card has been played. Play continues until at least one player is dead.

139199.name: Rogue
139199.description:
-Seize them! ...said the King.
My chambers were robbed!!
Those bandits took my treasures and they are escaping through the castle!

In Rogue you own one of the four thieves groups: Cult of Masks, Sentinels, Fox Guild, Narrow Path Clan and your purpose is to become the Master Rogue by leading your group to have the more Victory Points at the end of the game. To do that you must collect the most Treasure tokens. Each player owns 11 cards, 4 Master Thieves, 6 Gambits and 1 Black Market card (score card which gives you points depending on the treasure you have collected).

Each player chooses 1 Master Thief and 3 Gambits to begin the game and places the chosen cards face down on the table in an accessible (by all the players) area. All these cards form a mini deck of 16 cards. You never shuffle the deck. Now you cut the deck 3 times (one time each player) and the last player takes the deck, deals the cards on the table (4 rows x 4 cards each row, from the top left to the bottom right) and plays first. In each round, the player can do one of the following actions:Reveal a hidden card or to Exchange one of the cards in his/her hand, with a hidden card on the table. In that case the player who chooses the 2nd action, must place his new card faced up but note that this action costs you -1 Victory Point at the end of the game.

The Gambit cards have 2 different colored dice from the four colors you will find in the game (red, blue, green, yellow). When a Gambit card is revealed and in the same column (vertically) there is another Gambit, a Dispute takes place between the two. The players who own these Gambits, roll the corresponding dice and the one with the most hits takes a Treasure token. The Treasure tokens are faced down aside and when a dispute is commencing, you take one such token in random and place it on the Gambit cards, revealing the Treasure (the cards have been designed specifically for this purpose). In case of a tied dispute, the Treasure is lost (the King's guardians snatch it as your thieves flea to take cover). In case the 2 Gambits belong to the same thieves group, no dispute takes place as they work together to get the treasure. The player who owns them, takes a Treasure token immediately!

Each colored die represents a basic element: blue for Aqua, red for Ignis, green for Terra, yellow for Aura. The Master Thieve cards have those elements. The Master Thieves give additional skills to the Gambits when a Dispute takes place. For example when you roll a Red and a Green die for your Gambit and there is a faced up Master Thief on the table (your or your rivals') which represents Terra (green die), you add +1 Hit to the final result! Yet nothing is over. The Black Market cards have 4 different combinations of the Treasures, different for each player which grant him Victory Points, depending on the combination.
